alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Goochland; Powhatan; Western Essex; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 7:22PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of northern Chesterfield, northwestern King and Queen, southeastern Goochland, Henrico, southern Caroline, northwestern King William, Hanover, eastern Powhatan and central Essex Counties and the City of Richmond through 800 PM EST... At 721 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near Ladysmith to near Sabot to near Macon. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Ashland, Tappahannock, Moseley, University Of Richmond, Saint Stephens Church, Randolph Macon College, Virginia Commonwealth University, Tuckahoe, Highland Springs, Downtown Richmond, Bon Air, Virginia Union University, Mechanicsville, Chester, Hanover, Oilville, Manakin, Bellwood and Dawn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
